Prerequisites: PREREQUISITE:  ACG2001 WITH A GRADE OF "C" OR BETTER.
Course Description: THIS COURSE IS THE SECOND IN THE TWO-COURSE PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING SEQUENCE.  STUDENTS WILL USE TECHNOLOGY TO PREPARE AND USE FINANCIAL INFORMATION.  SPECIFICALLY, STUDENTS WILL STUDY TRANSACTIONS CONCERNING FIXED ASSETS, CURRENT AND LONG-TERM LIABILITIES, SHAREHOLDERS EQUITY; PREPARE THE CASE FLOW STATEMENT; AND ANALYZE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS.  THE COURSE FOCUSES ON SERVICE AND MERCHANDISING BUSINESSES OPERATING AS SOLE PROPRIETORSHIPS, PARTNERSHIPS, AND CORPORATIONS.  A COMPREHENSIVE OUTSIDE ASSIGNMENT IS REQUIRED IN THIS COURSE.
Textbook(s): PRINCIPLES OF ACCOUNTING, 7TH EDITION, BY NEEDLES, POWERS, MILLS, AND ANDERSON
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
